sentence: Lowe's Companies Inc.LOW posted dismal performance for yet another quarter with second-quarter fiscal 2015 earnings coming in below expectations.
The company reported second-quarter earnings per share of $1.20, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.23.
However, bottom-line results increased 15.4% from the year-ago quarter driven by the synergies gained from an improving housing market.
However, the impact of the improvement was short of what analysts had anticipated.
Further, Management reiterated its fiscal 2015 guidance despite signals of strong recovery in the housing market.
Shares of this home improvement retailer dropped about 1.3% in the pre-market session following the announcement.
On the other hand, Lowe's generated total revenue of $17,348 million, up 4.5% year over year and ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $17,308 million.
Comparable-store sales (comps) increased 4.3% on a consolidated basis in the quarter, while U.S. comps grew 4.6%.
In dollar terms, gross profit rose 4.3% year over year to $5,981 million, whereas gross profit margin contracted 8 basis points (bps) to 34.47%, mainly due to increase in cost of sales.
Lowe's ended the quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $901 million, long-term debt (excluding current maturities) of $10,345 million and shareholders' equity of $8,687 million.
During the quarter, the company repurchased $1.5 billion worth of its common stock and distributed $218 million as dividends.
Lowe's reiterated its fiscal 2015 guidance.
The company continues to expect sales growth of 4.5-5% while comps, on a consolidated basis, for the year are estimated to grow in the range of 4-4.5%.
Operating margin is expected to expand by nearly 80 bps to 100 bps.
Further, Lowe's still expects earnings for fiscal 2015 to be $3.29 per share.
Currently, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for the fiscal stands at $3.28 per share.
Moreover, the company intends to open 15-20 home improvement and hardware stores in the fiscal.
As of Jul 31, 2015, the company operated 1,846 stores in the United States, Canada and Mexico.
A better-ranked stock in the same industry is The Home Depot, Inc. HD , with a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Some stocks in the related industry worth considering are Tempur Sealy International Inc. TPX with a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) and Restoration Hardware Holdings Inc. RH holding a Zacks Rank #2.
